intro: Elatostema subpenninerve, commonly known as the narrow-veined elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptical leaves with a distinct, narrow midrib. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically in the axils of the leaves. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including parts of India and Southeast Asia. Elatostema subpenninerve is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
